# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/win32-x64/lldb/lib/encodings/cp856.py
@source-hash: 2e52ec5cb1eafa67
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:10:45Z

## Purpose
Auto-generated Python character encoding codec for CP856 (Hebrew character set), providing bidirectional conversion between bytes and Unicode characters. Part of LLDB's encoding support infrastructure.

## Key Components

### Core Codec Classes
- **Codec (L9-15)**: Main codec implementation with encode/decode methods using charmap operations
- **IncrementalEncoder (L17-19)**: Streaming encoder for partial input processing
- **IncrementalDecoder (L21-23)**: Streaming decoder for partial input processing
- **StreamWriter (L25-26)**: File-like writing interface (empty pass-through)
- **StreamReader (L28-29)**: File-like reading interface (empty pass-through)

### Registration Interface
- **getregentry() (L33-42)**: Returns CodecInfo object for Python's codec registry system, binding all codec components under 'cp856' name

### Character Mapping Tables
- **decoding_table (L47-304)**: 256-element tuple mapping byte values (0x00-0xFF) to Unicode characters
  - 0x00-0x7F: Standard ASCII characters
  - 0x80-0x9A: Hebrew letters (Alef through Tav)
  - 0x9B-0xFF: Mixed special characters, box-drawing symbols, and undefined positions (\ufffe)
- **encoding_table (L307)**: Auto-generated reverse mapping using codecs.charmap_build()

## Dependencies
- **codecs**: Python's codec infrastructure for charmap_encode/decode operations and codec registration

## Architecture Patterns
- Standard Python codec pattern with incremental and streaming variants
- Character mapping approach using lookup tables for O(1) conversion
- Auto-generation from external mapping specification (CP856.TXT)

## Critical Constraints
- Fixed 256-character mapping (single-byte encoding)
- Undefined positions marked with \ufffe (65534) - will raise encoding errors
- Hebrew character block at 0x80-0x9A maintains original CP856 specification
